conclusion: Solving thermodynamics problem using PV diagram information
State A: P = 1×10⁵ Pa, V = 2 L
State B: P = 4×10⁵ Pa, V = 2 L
State C: P = 1×10⁵ Pa, V = 5 L
B→C: Process with decreasing pressure and increasing volume
C→A: Isothermal process (horizontal line at P = 1×10⁵ Pa)
Using ideal gas law PV = nRT
Variables: P = pressure, V = volume, n = number of moles, R = gas constant, T = temperature
For ideal gas with constant mass: (P_A V_A)/T_A = (P_B V_B)/T_B
Given values: T_A = 200 K, P_A = 1×10⁵ Pa, V_A = 2 L, P_B = 4×10⁵ Pa, V_B = 2 L
Solving for T_B: T_B = (P_B V_B T_A)/(P_A V_A)
Calculation: T_B = (4×10⁵ Pa)(2 L)(200 K)/(1×10⁵ Pa)(2 L)
Final answer: Temperature at state B is 800 K
